body_html: The comment looks true to me; the graph building code works for any batch dimension. features["x"] is the thing that should have an unknown batch dimension, not some reshape down the line. And you get that by using export_savedmodel with placeholders (or, if not using Estimator, by setting features["x"] to a placeholder manually).
body_text: The comment looks true to me; the graph building code works for any batch dimension. features["x"] is the thing that should have an unknown batch dimension, not some reshape down the line. And you get that by using export_savedmodel with placeholders (or, if not using Estimator, by setting features["x"] to a placeholder manually).
body: The comment looks true to me; the graph building code works for any batch dimension. `features["x"]` is the thing that should have an unknown batch dimension, not some reshape down the line. And you get that by using `export_savedmodel` with placeholders (or, if not using Estimator, by setting `features["x"]` to a placeholder manually).
